name: Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Pockets
description: Homemade copycat hot pockets filled with ooey gooey melted cheese, chicken and broccoli. Easy and freezer-friendly!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place broccoli florets into a steamer or colander set over a pan of boiling water. Cover and steam for 5 mins, or until cooked through and vibrant green; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Place broccoli florets into a steamer or colander set over a pan of boiling water. Cover and steam for 5 mins, or until cooked through and vibrant green; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine chicken, cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise and garlic powder; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine chicken, cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise and garlic powder; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove rolls from the can, separating them into 8 rectangles, 2 triangles each. Press each rectangle to form a 6×4-inch rectangle, firmly pressing perforations to seal.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove rolls from the can, separating them into 8 rectangles, 2 triangles each. Press each rectangle to form a 6×4-inch rectangle, firmly pressing perforations to seal.

recipeInstructions.text: Top half of each rectangle with chicken mixture and broccoli. Fold dough from the top over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.
recipeInstructions.name: Top half of each rectangle with chicken mixture and broccoli. Fold dough from the top over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.

recipeInstructions.text: Place onto the prepared baking sheet and bake until golden brown, about 12-13 minutes.*
recipeInstructions.name: Place onto the prepared baking sheet and bake until golden brown, about 12-13 minutes.*

review.reviewBody: My family LOVED these!!! Even my picky toddlers loved them!! I didn't have broccoli on hand, so substituted spinach... YUM!!! I am making them again tonight and came back for the recipe and just HAD to leave a comment!! Thanks for the great, easy recipe!!
This is my first time to  make these... do you need to defrost them before re-heating them after they've been frozen?
